Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of rosette in added white outline with added red fill; exterior: dilute glaze line on top of rim; below, painted decoration consisting of seated lion (only part of hindquarters with red patch and tail remaining), to right; dot rosette as filling ornament.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ1 ('bothros' / 'trench with bowls'), AΠ190 or AP20 from the bottom of the sand in the temenos
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 50, pl. V, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1064) (phase 2)
